paragraphs.content: Chapter 27
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 27

paragraphs.content: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

paragraphs.content: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
paragraphs.contentHtml: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

paragraphs.content: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

paragraphs.content: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

paragraphs.content: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

paragraphs.content: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

paragraphs.content: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

paragraphs.content: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

paragraphs.content: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

paragraphs.content: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

paragraphs.content: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

paragraphs.content: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

paragraphs.content: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

paragraphs.content: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

paragraphs.content: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

paragraphs.content: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

paragraphs.content: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

paragraphs.content: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

paragraphs.content: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

paragraphs.content: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

paragraphs.content: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

paragraphs.content: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

paragraphs.content: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
